body.p: DITA tables are a powerful feature that allows you to organize and present data in a structured manner. The table element is used to create tables in DITA.

section.title: Creating a Basic Table
section.p: To create a basic table, you need to use the table element along with its child elements: row, entry, and entrytbl.

A row element represents a row in the table. Inside each row, you can have multiple entry elements, which represent the cells in that row. If you want to create nested tables within a cell, you can use the entrytbl element.

section.p: To add headers to your table, you can use the thead and th elements. The thead element is used to group the header rows, and the th element represents a header cell.

section.p: You can apply styles to your DITA tables using CSS. You can target the table, row, entry, and entrytbl elements to customize their appearance.

section.title: Using DITA Tables with Other DITA Elements
section.p: DITA tables can be used in conjunction with other DITA elements to create more complex structures. For example, you can nest tables within tables, or include tables within steps or procedures.
When using tables within other DITA elements, make sure to follow the appropriate DITA structure and nesting rules.
